Transcription for 19095

A

It worked like this, when you were married and you had a boy coming up to
colliery status at 13 and you were leaving school, you'd have, you'd get
knowledge of one of the men about the village, went to the workmen's Institute
which was just coming into vogue, or about the football field, they want a boy
underground, they want a boy. They would go and see that man, ask him could you
come to work with him underground, right, oh he'd fix up with the officials of the
colliery and they would just sign on and away to go.

B

It worked like this. When you were married and you had a boy coming up to
Calvary status at 13 and you were leaving school, you'd get knowledge of
one of the men about the village that went to the Workman's Institute which was just
coming into vogue, or about the football. He'd want a boy underground. He'd want a boy.
They'd go and see that man, ask him, could you come to work with him underground?
Well right, he'd fix up with the officials of the Coloury and he'd just signed on and away to go.

C

It worked like this, when you were married,
and you had a boy coming up to Colery status at 13,
then you were leaving school,
you would get knowledge of one of the men
about the village, went to the Workman's Institute,
which was just coming into vogue,
or about the football field,
you want a boy underground, you want a boy.
Then you go and see that man, ask him,
could you come to work with him underground,
and write who he'd fix up with,
the officials of Colery, who just signed on,
and away to go.
